title: Matildas star Steph Catley shows off her incredibly athletic bikini body as she enjoys holiday in Greece
body_text:
Matildas star Steph Catley shows off her incredibly athletic bikini body as she enjoys holiday in Greece
Steph Catley enjoyed a much needed holiday in Santorini, Greece this week as she stripped down to a bikini and soaked up the sun.
The Matildas star, 29, flaunted her athletic figure on Thursday when she shared a reel of photos documenting her lavish getaway.
Showing off her toned abs, the reel began with an image of the soccer legend relaxing on a boat as she slipped into a bright yellow two-piece and sun-bathed.
'A few days to recharge in Greece,' she captioned the photos which also saw her enjoying a cool dip in the ocean before she went for a sunset dinner beachside.
It seems Steph particularly enjoyed going out on the boat as she spent many of her vacation days living it up on the water with delicious foods and fruity drinks.
Steph Catley, 29, (pictured) enjoyed a much needed holiday in Santorini, Greece this week as she stripped down to a bikini and soaked up the sun
On one of her final days, she decided to stay in her villa and instead lounged by her pool as the sun beat down on her toned stomach.
Steph's getaway was much needed after the plane which carried her Arsenal women's team back from Germany caught fire.
The players were on their way home from their Champions league semi-final first leg with Wolfsburg when their aircraft burst into flames on the runway last month.
The Matildas star flaunted her athletic figure on Thursday when she shared a reel of photos documenting her lavish getaway
Showing off her toned abs, the reel began with an image of the soccer legend relaxing on a boat as she slipped into a bright yellow two-piece and sun-bathed
The incident occurred at the Braunschweig Wolfsburg Airport after a bird flew into the engine shortly before it was due to take off, causing a loud bang.
Flames immediately burst of the left engine of the Boeing 737, and the pilots quickly evacuated the passengers, including Arsenal's first team squad, to safety.
Arsenal released a statement confirming they returned home safely not long after the incident.
'A few days to recharge in Greece,' she captioned the photos which also saw her enjoying a cool dip in the ocean before she went for a sunset dinner beachside
It seems Steph particularly enjoyed going out on the boat as she spent many of her vacation days living it up on the water with delicious foods and fruity drinks
The statement at the time read: 'Our aircraft developed a technical issue prior to take-off in Germany on Sunday evening.
'As a result, we remained in Wolfsburg overnight on Sunday before flying back to England on Monday afternoon.
'We would like to thank the staff onboard the aircraft and on the ground at the airport for their assistance.'
The team used a Maltese airline to fly to Germany on the Saturday, and were due to fly back with the same airline the following evening.
